  • Method Details

    • withShape

      IterByOrIterFromOrAllTensor<V> withShape(int... shape)
      Define a tensor shape by passing an array of int values to this method, which represent the shape of the Tensor that should be built. This should be called immediately after having specified the type of the tensor.
      Specified by:
      withShape in interface WithShapeOrScalarOrVector<V>
      Parameters:
      shape - The shape array of the Tensor that should be built.
      Returns:
      The next step in the call transition graph of this fluent builder API.

    • withShape

      default <N extends Number> IterByOrIterFromOrAllTensor<V> withShape(List<N> shape)
      Define a tensor shape by passing a list of numbers to this method, which represent the shape of the Tensor that should be built. This should be called immediately after having specified the type of the tensor.
      Specified by:
      withShape in interface WithShapeOrScalarOrVector<V>
      Parameters:
      shape - The shape list of the Tensor that should be built.
      Returns:
      The next step in the call transition graph of this fluent builder API.

      Tensor<V> vector(V... values)
      This method creates and returns a vector Tensor instance which wraps the provided values.
      Specified by:

      Parameters:
      values - The values which ought to be wrapped by a new vector Tensor instance.
